page.title: 02CHANGES IN FINCHLEY
page.content: In recent years there have been many changes in Finchley. We now have a large Tesco supermarket which has replaced a shoe shop and Pope's Garage.Many Japanese have come to live in Finchley and they have opened their own special shop called the J.A.Centre.This was once Hall's Brothers, a haberdashery and clothes store.On the corner of Lichfield Grove there was a Baker's shop - this is now a restaurant.There was a picture palace called the Bohemia on the site of the Council Offices. There also used to be a roller skating rink. The library is now where the old Council Offices stood.They were bombed in 1940.St.May's Church Hall is in what used to be the very large Rectory Garden.Private houses have also been built on this area of land.
